reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pretty much on par with what you will read on this site. The staff is very nice and helpful. Rooms are small/cozy and as with many places in San Francisco there is no AC. We have found the nights to be cool enough when leaving windows open. The night cap of sherry is a very comfortable touch.
reviews.title: Consistent with what you read...

likes.disliked: — Room size/lack of refridgerator/microwave for leftovers :)

reviews.text: Location was great for what we wanted to do. We were able to walk to Pier 33 area to the south, Fisherman's Wharf to the north, and a great restaurant called Frascati's to the west. North Beach is primarily Italian restaurants. Also very close to Chinatown if you want to see that.
reviews.title: Had a pleasant stay here

likes.disliked: — A bit noisey at night (weekend) for our room facing the street

reviews.title: major overpriced disappointment
reviews.text: All and all it was what we expected and served our needs quite well.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed 2 nights at the hotel. Although it is not a plush modern hotel, we certainly thought it was a charming little place.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, there are some stairs and no elevators, but so what.. it is only one floor to climb. We carried our own luggage. Didn't even think twice about it.
reviews.title: Would not stay again

likes.disliked: — Samll rooms, lots of steps, no AC

reviews.title: Great boutique hotel
reviews.text: We spent three nights at Hotel Boheme in November at the start of our honeymoon. I travel a lot with work and so we wanted something different. The four poster bed was great and although the room was small (even by UK standards), it was clean and full of character. The staff were very friendly and helpful. There were lots of local restaurants, cafes and attractions, including City Lights book store which is a couple of blocks away. If you like the cafe culture of the mediterranean, then I'd recommend this hotel as the atmosphere of the area is very similar.

We stayed here for four nights, when we drew up outside it was just a door way in a busy street but when you get in side its lovely. A lady called kate checked us in and gave all the information we needed, she even one night phoned through a takeaway pizza order for us as our mobile didnt work! Our room was very comfortable with two double beds, tv and shower room. Only little thing it would have been nice to have coffee making facilities in the room. We were located in italian quarter so lots of great italian restaurants. Not far from china town either which is worth a wonder. We found a fantastic cafe for breakfast called pats cafe it has a bright yellow front. and is located in taylor street. Found it on our first morning we were jet lagged and starving, food and service were excellent and the coffee kept comming! Kept us going till the evening! Not far to pier 39 but we recommend going in the morning its quiet but a little tacky and go and see Alcatraz its brilliant book tickets before you go we went 9am boat and its quieter. All in all we loved the hotel we would definately recommed it to friends.
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.text: Stayed at the Hotel Boheme for the last two night in the San Francisco, Napa Valley, Carmel vacation. We had three people in our party the first night we had a fine room with two queen beds. We knew we had to change rooms the second night to a queen bed and a futon. Well the futon turned out to be a small dirty cushon on the floor. The room window was next to the exhaust
reviews.title: Fifty Fifty at the Hotel Bohème

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: vent of the restaurant on the first floor it sounded like a jet engine. We got no sleep that night. The hotel is on the second floor with only a very narrow stairway.
reviews.title: Living SMALL and WELL in North Beach

likes.liked: — Location in North Beach and congenial staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel is in a great location in Little Italy. Just make sure you do not stay in Room 207. or if they request a futon run to a different hotel.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Hotel Appearance is a doorway off the street. Don't expect to see a hotel/B&B frontage. You wouldn't realise it was a hotel at all - as it is also surrounded in restaurants.
reviews.title: A lovely stay in a Great Location!
Fantastic Hotel
reviews.text: Check In was standard, nothing exceptional. However, we were shocked to realise we had to walk a narrow, winding staircase to the Reception, and further staircase to our room. Whilst the gentleman at the desk kindly assisted with our cases, we still needed to 'lug' our bags up all these suitcases.
Rooms are quite small, like an English B&B - whereby you have a room in a house, rather than a room in a Hotel. However, rooms where very clean.
reviews.title: reviews were right. we loved this hotel!

reviews.text: Hotel is centrally located to everything. Restaurants at your doorstep. Fishermans Wharf only 15 minute walk.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The highlights for our stay were : Fishermans Wharf, Alcatraz, walking the Golden Gate, the italian restaurant next door to hotel was excellent (alfresco dining), the trams. Great shopping down at Fishermans Wharf too.
reviews.title: What a fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was disapointed by Hotel Boheme, and for once i don’t share the general opinion of the T.A. reviews .
reviews.title: A great deco.. what else?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OK, the deco is great , there is a special atmosphere , and the location is good , even if i prefer Union Square .... but , what else ?
reviews.title: loved the boheme

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is no elevator, be prepared if you have heavy suitcases ; our room was small, there was no bathtub , only a shower, no coffeemaker , the TV was a bit larger than a box of matches (bring binoculars if you actually intend to watch it ) , and the room was directly on Colombus avenue , an important street of San Francisco with a lot of traffic night and day , and peole speaking loudly or screaming .. night and day too !
reviews.title: Nice little hotel!

likes.liked: — Unique, great neighborhood, friendly and helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is professional , i wouldn’t say friendly .
reviews.title: Great Boheme

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast is not included and even not possible ; ok, there is a big choice of cafes around , but it makes an aditional cost on the bill.
reviews.title: Don't even think of choosing any other hotel in SF!
